hints.content:
Every bill has a different value.

Dollar name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
One dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/526e9b19f2c39d0d908b6c531d510186f6e93e97.png) | $\$1$
Five dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/5069901d0226c2c5f1c3e73b2b5d7e48ee1e1eee.png) | $\$5$
Ten dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/35b0286a92e1825d39af39b5e362e5d9674eb00d.png) | $\$10$
Twenty dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/66f0febd8ba41a0e3413f72b2f1fc2d54a3819de.png) | $\$20$

Let's label the value of each set of bills and find the total.

###$4$ ten dollar bills and $3$ one dollar bills

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}} + \underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{40}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}} 
+\underbrace{\$\blueE{3}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$43
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$43$, so it is **not** equal to $\$34$.

###$3$ twenty dollar bills and $4$ one dollar bills

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} +  \underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{60}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} +\underbrace{\$\blueE{3}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$63
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$63$, so it is **not** equal to $\$34$.

###$1$ twenty dollar bill, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $4$ one dollar bills

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ twenty dollar bill}}} +\underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}} +   \underbrace{\$\blueE{1} +\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{4}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ twenty dollar bill}}} +\underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}} + \underbrace{\$\blueE{4}}_{\blueE{4}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$34
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$34$, so it **is** equal to Amy's amount of money.

Amy could have this set of bills:

$1$ twenty dollar bill, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $4$ one dollar bills

question.content:
Amy has $\$34$.

**Which set of bills could Amy have?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $4$ ten dollar bills and $3$ one dollar bills
$3$ twenty dollar bills and $4$ one dollar bills
$1$ twenty dollar bill, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $4$ one dollar bills
